transcription.text: "Sound is what truly convinces the mind it is in a place," said videogame designer Jesse Schell. "In other words, hearing is believing." Sound is an essential part of storytelling, whether it's ambient noise, roaring sound effects or a musical score swelling over the action. It helps communicate what's happening, not just in narrative features and television but also in documentaries, news programmes and commercials. One of the items displayed here is a vintage Nagra audio tape recorder used by Channel 7 News in Sydney during the 1960s and early 1970s when external news footage was shot on 16mm reversal film. The syncing of sound and vision occurred back in the editing room before going to air.
